vulnerable_code: SecureRandom sr = new SecureRandom(); BigInteger i = BigInteger.valueOf(sr.nextInt()); byte [] bytes = i.toByteArray();
description: Using `SecureRandom.nextInt()` to generate a BigInteger is not considered secure. This method returns an integer of 31 bits which might be less than 16 bytes.
recommendation: Use `SecureRandom.nextBytes()` method to generate random IV which ensures a fixed 16 bytes for AES/CBC mode, as it is the standard way to initialize the IV.
